Text:
Thanks again STFmaryville, this is another one I wanted to get xD

PS. If I may, I'd like to make another request, I'm looking for volumes 2 and 3 of the "Dragonlance Legends" trilogy ("War of the twins" and "Test of the twins").

From the little information I found about this, I'm not 100% sure they ever got printed, but I'm sure you're more of an expert on this than me :P
This is GREAT! Thank you so much! We need more Avatar stuff.
Hamster-X, Devil's Due restructured in December 2008 and they haven't published another Dragonlance comic since then.

Ah, so I feared. :(

While I'm nagging you with requests, this might be a similar issue (non print) as it's also by Devil's Due: "Forgotten Realms: The Legacy" (3 issues total, also known as "The legend of Drizzt: Book VII").

Although for these 3 issues I've manged to find a ton of dead links, which leads me to believe they were actually released.
those were released, they were scanned by Whitewolf-DCP back in '08. looking 4 them.
Excellent! While we're looking, do you have the entire 'Beware the Superman' trilogy i.e. Black Summer, No Hero, and Supergod? I have Black Summer in paper form, but I've never read Supergod.
aegnoralkarin, here's black summer http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/6114988/Black_Summer_Mini_Series . will look 4 supergod, as i only have #1

yes, thank you!!

btw, supergod is on here, a mirrormaster upload:

http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/6057291/WARREN_ELLIS_-_SUPERGOD_01-05_(_complete_)

imho, it's the best story in the trilogy- best art too, but i have to admit i don't like ryps style too much, his panels are just too.... busy.

hey thanks i don't know why i didn't search on here, must have brain flu! i'll read that 2morrow. i've been backtracking thru some ellis super-hero comics, as i haven't read his run of astonishing x-men, for example.  :-)
